title: What's News: Business & Finance
text:
Dollar-bond defaults from Chinese property developers are rising quickly as China's housing market slumps, and the problem could worsen.

Snap said it expects growth to slow in the current quarter due to recent changes to Apple's App Store privacy rules, sending its stock down 22% after hours.

The S&P 500 rose 0.3% to close at a record, while the Nasdaq gained 0.6%. The Dow slipped 0.02%.

Investors piled into shares of the special-purpose acquisition company taking Trump's new social-media platform public.

Western Digital's talks to merge with Japanese chip maker Kioxia Holdings in a $20 billion-plus deal have stalled.

What's News: Business & Finance
